captions.text:
Suit up in a $9,500 Batman scalemaille suit
of armor and reload your mass effect nerf

gun because this is episode number 15 of Game
LÜT.

Relax on some Borderlands 2 plush pillows
and while you play Bioshock Infinite the board

game with some friends. If you catch someone
cheating, intimidate them with your Iron Man

3 Arc Reactor tshirt...that actually lights
up, a Halo Needler model kit that you can

construct yourself and then check out some
insane Skyrim props from Folkenstal...

If there is no one to play with, at least
you have these video game figures by Fast

4 Figures and you can build these new lego
minecraft sets for the nether and the village.

Or make some really cool Pokémon Papercrafts.
Once you finish, display them all proudly

on your Avengers themed desk and illuminate
it with an NES Controller LED lamp. Add some

Zelda stained glass wall decals by Blik to
tie the room together...

Or decorate yourself with Animal Crossing
badges and some Faster Than Light pins.

Sadly, we can't travel faster than light so
throw on a Spider-Man motorcycle helmet and

fly through the air on a 16ft tall life size
star wars scout walker that can be yours for
only 9,800 pounds. (a wild hulk appears)

If it's too pricey but you still want that
perpetual wind blown hair look, try some Dragon

Ball Z hair wax. I think it would work well
for you, I mean I'm just saiyan...tshirt.

On a scale from 1 to 10, that hair and tshirt
combo will take you over 9000 - NO. NO. NO.

Instead let's journey to a sacred realm with
these Spiritual stone necklaces. They'd be

perfect with d-pad earrings and a Pikachu
Dress...or pikachu leggings. Heck, why not

go crazy and get a Harley Quinn bustier. I'm
sorry, that might have been a bit forward

so let me be brief...batman briefs with included
butt cape.

If you're a Shy Guy give her this I Love You
card and take a leap of faith with these custom

Assassin's Creed shoes. If it doesn't work
out, pack your emotional baggage into some

Game Boy luggage. Then burn every image of
her with a Team Fortress 2 Pyro lighter. Don't

catch a cold from her ice heart so put on
a Final Fantasy Shin-Ra hoodie and Iron Man
fingerless gloves

But really, who needs love or human interaction
when you can virtually interact inside video

games. STEM System is a wireless motion tracker
designed for gaming. It is the same technology

that powers the Razer Hydra but more complete.
You can use it on it's own or attach it to

something like the Oculus rift for some crazy
virtual reality that will probably just melt

your mind. It supposedly has hardly any latency
and, since it doesn't require a camera, is
free of line of sight limitations.

If you follow me on Twitter and Instagram
I posted video game art from the 3NES art

show I went to...and if you don't why...but
here are some more prints from the show you
can get that are awesome.

Never lose track of time again with an arcade
button watch, subscribe to Vsauce3 for more

Game LÜT and when the pimp's in the crib
ma, drop it like a pot.
I'm Jake and as always, thanks for watching.

title: GET THIS HALO GUN! -- Game LÜT #15
